data.question: What is the crystal system of the chiral crystalline sponge (S,S)-1?
What method is used for the separation of racemic mixtures in the study?
Is the space group of (R,R)-1 and (S,S)-1 the same?
What is the Flack (Parson) parameter for the crystal structure of (S,S)-1•(2R,3R)-3?
Which solvent is preferred for guest inclusion experiments due to its less tightly bounded nature within the coordination networks?
Does the study involve the use of X-ray diffraction for structural analysis?
What is the purpose of using chiral crystalline sponges in the study?
data.answer: For the determination of the absolute configurations of chiral compounds

data.question: Are the crystallographic tables provided for all reported crystal structures?

What analytical technique is used to confirm the absolute configuration of (+)-3?

data.answer: To separate the enantiomers of racemic mixtures

data.question: Can the crystal system of (S,S)-1 be determined directly from its space group?
What is the volume (V) in Å3 of the crystal structure (R,R)-1•(S)-7?
Is the temperature for all crystallographic analyses conducted at 100 K?

data.answer: It is used to confirm the absolute configuration of the chiral compounds

data.question: Are all crystal structures reported in the study solved in the orthorhombic crystal system?
What is the chemical shift reference used in NMR spectroscopy in the study?
What is the purpose of using cyclohexane or n-hexane for solvent exchange?
data.answer: To replace nitrobenzene guests in the pores before guest inclusion experiments
